title: Roles of Labor Union Learning Representatives and Strategies for Promoting Organizational Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Labor Union Functions and Experience with Organizational Learning Programs
context.additional_context: Customized education for labor union learning representatives in science-based enterprises, focusing on developing organizational learning facilitation competencies via VR simulations and real-case analysis.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the four core roles of labor union learning representatives: information sharing, learning needs analysis, resource linkage, and performance monitoring
Learners can design and implement strategies to improve learning accessibility for vulnerable groups (e.g., elderly, low-literacy individuals) using VR-based simulations

Learners will develop an organizational learning facilitation plan (including objectives, implementation steps, and evaluation metrics) applicable to real-world corporate environments (e.g., cross-team collaboration issues, new technology adoption cases) through a 3-week project-based assessment, submit it in the form of a 5-minute presentation and 3-page report, and achieve an 'Excellent' grade in 4 out of 5 rubric criteria.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
